content: @NGO, TUAN @Jose Costa Teixeira creating a topic to discuss IG for HIV case reporting.
@Jose Costa Teixeira has made a start on GitHub....https://github.com/openhie/hiv-ig
This is using one of the word doc case report forms that was sent earlier. I don't know if this was the official one or not
Also adding in @James Agnew for the HAPI+Elastic search side of things. (James, we should have a quick call this week)

Hi @NGO, TUAN do we have a db schema for the HIV reporting system? To see what data structures we have there.
Also the tables with the coded values would help create our valuesets - for example "treatment status" .
hi @Jose Costa Teixeira , currently we do not have it yet. but let me ask the developer who is dev HIV info; CDC/VN has sent me the dictionary code but still need to de deduplicate and re-standard
Did we ever get the schema @NGO, TUAN ?
no, they may not share. but i think the current schema should be replace to improve the performance

hey @NGO, TUAN , @Jose Costa Teixeira and I are looking at the case report data and we need to know some of the value sets/allowed values for a few of the data fields:
Gender
Occupation
Risk behavior
Transmission route
have you seen "official" values for this or suggest a place to try and get a starter list for each?
@Nguyen Huu Kien @Cuong Nguyen
Welcome @Cuong Nguyen @Nguyen Huu Kien
Thanks @NGO, TUAN for adding them
@Jose Costa Teixeira I suggested they start mapping the HIV Info Excel sheet to the questionnaire. We can discuss details here
Dear Carl and Jose, we are going to request to have HIVinfo data schema, and trying to mapping next Tuesday. do you have any instruction?

hi @NGO, TUAN i think this document could be a good start , particularly the example on page 7. we should create a google sheet for that table that we can use and share with others. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MFVBqnxeHU14SHqIeiuho9613yHi0dSc8CPGfG9B77w/edit
you can do the transformation in pretty much any language, though unix friendly is probably better
